page.title: 03HISTORY, FARMING & BUSINESS.
page.content: The most westerly point of road B6050 stands at 1,000ft. above sea-level. From here Lincoln Cathedral can be seen on a clear day. Sheffield and Chesterfield are clearly visible day and night. There is one Public House called the Gate Inn with a Telephone Box outside. The headmistress of Cutthorpe School lives at Cowclose Farm. Her husband keeps a small flock of Jacobs Sheep. Pratt Hall is a 16th Century Hamlet and here there is a Medieval Cruck barn. The Hamlet consists of a hall called Pratt Hall, a Methodist Chapel converted to a house and two cottages, lying on each side of an old packhorse route which is now a Public Bridle Way. There are 4 farms, mostly hay and beasts for butchering. Businesses at Oxton Rakes include the making of parts for heavy machinery & also a Haulage Contractor.
